synopsis: In episode #12 of the podcast, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome the talented musician Valante, who shares his inspiring journey through life, creativity, and the importance of embracing existence. The conversation delves into personal struggles, the impact of childhood experiences, and the beauty of creating art from life's complexities, all while fostering a sense of connection and understanding.
quotes: If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
I think it's really brave to decide to leave your job and throw yourself into the unknown.
I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
You can really change the world in small ways, I believe.
Just because you're not giving up all of your possessions doesn't mean you're not helping.
I used to think that artists who said they were channeling from the universe were cringey, but now I am one of those people.
There's so much joy in just lying down in the grass and soaking in the smells and feelings.
You can expect music. That's it. There's no plan, no roadmap.
Take the opportunity and tell the people close to you that you love them. Don't wait.
